description.text: Reports the value of the variable.

Reports the text shown.

Reports the boolean false.

Agents moves steps forward.
description.arg-description: Number of steps to move.

description.text: Agents moves steps backward.
description.arg-description: Number of steps to move.

description.text: Makes agents turn degrees to the left.
description.arg-description: Number of degrees to turn.

description.text: Makes agents turn degrees to the right.
description.arg-description: Number of degrees to turn.

description.text: Heights of agents increase by steps.
description.arg-description: Number of steps to move up.

description.text: Heights of agents decrease by steps.
description.arg-description: Number of steps to move down.

description.text: Sets the x and y coordinates (a.k.a. position) of an agent
If is true, the agent will run the blocks attached to
description.arg-description: The condition being tested.
The set of instructions that is done when the condition is true.

description.text: Does the first set of commands if the condition specified is true, otherwise it will do the second set of commands.
description.arg-description: The condition being tested.
The set of instructions that is done when the condition is true.
The set of instructions that is done when the condition is false.

description.text: Repeats some commands times.
description.arg-description: The number of times to repeat the command.
The commands to do.

description.text: Reports true if one or both of the two conditions are true.
description.arg-description: The first condition that must be true.
The second condition that must be true.

description.text: Reports true if both of the two conditions are true.
description.arg-description: The first condition that must be true.
The second condition that must be true.

description.text: Reports the opposite of .
description.arg-description: The boolean (true or false) that should be inverted.

description.text: Counts all agents that satisfy a certain condition.
description.arg-description: The condition an agent must satisfy to be counted

description.text: Reports the number of agents that are currently alive.
Causes this agent to "say" the supplied text by popping up a speech bubble in SpaceLand.
Displays the text attached to this block in the bottom panel of Spaceland.
Causes agent to play a sound with the following . Select a sound from the Sounds drawer and attach to this block.
description.arg-description: The text name of the sound to play.

description.text: Returns a text representation of the given block(s) connected to this.
Appends to the end of .
description.arg-description: The text to which to append .
The text to append to .

description.text: Reports the value of PI (approximately 3.14).
Reports the mathematical number e, which is about 2.718.
Reports the sum of two numbers ( + ).
Reports the difference of two numbers ( - ).
Reports the product of two numbers ( x ).
Reports the quotient of two numbers ( ÷ ).
Determines if two quantities are equal ( = ).
Determines if two quantities are different ( != ).
description.arg-description: The first thing to compare.
The second thing to compare.

description.arg-description: The first thing to compare.
The second thing to compare.

description.text: Reports whether the is less than or equal to the .

The second thing to compare.

description.arg-description: The first thing to compare.
The second thing to compare.

description.text: Reports whether the is greater than or equal to the .

The second thing to compare.

description.text: Reports a random integer greater than or equal to 1 and less than or equal to .
description.arg-description: The upper integer in the range.

description.text: Rounds to the nearest integer.
description.arg-description: The number to round.

description.text: Reports the whole number part of the number.
Reports the integer remainder of divided by .
description.arg-description: The number to divide.
The number by which to divide.

description.text: Reports the smaller value of the two numbers.

description.arg-description: The first number to compare.
The second number to compare.

description.text: Reports the power of one number raised to another ( ^ ).

description.arg-description: A number from which to get the absolute value.

description.text: Reports the square root of .
description.arg-description: The number whose square root to take.

description.text: A Trigonmetric function that reports the sine of the specified angle.
description.arg-description: The angle in degrees for which the sine will be reported.

description.text: A Trigonmetric function that reports the cosine of the specified angle.
description.arg-description: The angle in degrees for which the cosine will be reported.

description.text: A Trigonmetric function that reports the tangent of the specified angle.
description.arg-description: The angle in degrees for which the tangent will be reported.

description.text: Trigonometric function that reports the arcsine of the specified number. All angles are reported in degrees.
description.arg-description: A number from which to get the arcsine.

description.text: Trigonometric function that reports the arccosine of the specified number. All angles are reported in degrees.
description.arg-description: A number from which to get the arccosine.

description.text: Reports the logarithm base 10 of . The return value x will be the number for which 10 to the power of x is equal to .
description.arg-description: The number of which to take the natural logarithm

description.text: Reports the natural logarithm of . The return value x will be the number for which the mathematical constant e, which is about 2.718, to the power of x is equal to .
description.arg-description: The number of which to take the natural logarithm

description.text: Reports the color of the patch where the agent is standing.
Changes the color of the patch on which this agent is to .
description.arg-description: The color to which to change the patch.

description.text: Reports the height of the patch where the agent is standing.
Decreases the height of the patch where the agent is standing, smoothly connecting the edges to surrounding patches.
description.arg-description: How much the patch height is decreased.

description.text: Increases the height of the patch where the agent is standing, smoothly connecting the edges to surrounding patches.
description.arg-description: How much the patch height is increased.

description.text: Sets the color of the agent to the given color.
Reports the color of this agent.
Sets the heading of this agent to the specified value in degrees.
Reports the angle, in degrees, where the agent is heading.
Reports the x coordinate of this agent.
Reports the y coordinate of this agent.
Reports the size, or scale, of this agent.
Sets the size of this agent's shape.
Reports the ID number, or "ID" of this agent.
Pulls the agent's pen up so the agent will not stamp every patch where it moves.
Pulls the agent's pen down so the agent will stamp every patch where it moves.
Reports true if this agent's pen is down, and false otherwise.
Reports the shape of this agent.
Reports the breed of this agent.
Causes this agent to change its shape to the supplied shape.
description.arg-description: The shape

description.text: Causes this agent to change its breed to the supplied breed.
description.arg-description: The name of the new breed.

description.text: Reports whether the up arrow key is being pressed. Arrow keys have a drop down menu that allow you to select other arrow keys.
Reports whether the down arrow key is being pressed. Arrow keys have a drop down menu that allow you to select other arrow keys.
Reports whether the left arrow key is being pressed. Arrow keys have a drop down menu that allow you to select other arrow keys.
Reports whether the right arrow key is being pressed. Arrow keys have a drop down menu that allow you to select other arrow keys.
Reports whether the space bar is being pressed.
Reports the current position along the x-axis of the joystick. Reports -1 at the extreme left position and +1 at the extreme right.
Reports the current position along the y-axis of the joystick. Reports -10 at the extreme left position and +10 at the extreme right.
Reports the current radius of the position of the joystick. Reports 0 when the joystick is in the center and 1 when it is full deflected in any direction.
Reports the current angle in degrees that the joystick is at, with 0 at the top and 180 at the bottom.
Reports the angle in degrees of the direction pad on a gamepad.
Reports true if the first joystick button is down and false if it is not.
Reports true if the second joystick button is down and false if it is not.
Reports true if the third joystick button is down and false if it is not.
Reports true if the fourth joystick button is down and false if it is not.
If is the ID number of a live agent, that agent will run the blocks attached to
description.arg-description: The ID of the agent being asked to run something.
The set of instructions that is run when by the asked agent.

description.text: Reports the ID number of the agent that is currently being followed by the camera.
Reports whether over-the-soulder view is on.
Turns the over-the-shoulder view on.
Reports whether agent-eye view is on.
Turns the agent-eye view on.
Returns true if the aerial camera view is on and false if it is off.
Turns the agent-eye view on.
Returns true if the overhead camera view is on and false if it is off.
Turns overhead camera mode on. This is a 2D aerial view of the entire spaceland with map view turned on.
Turns overhead camera mode off and goes back to the previous camera view.
Defines a section of blocks as a procedure that can be called from other sections of blocks.
Adds a number parameter to a procedure.
Adds a boolean parameter to a procedure.
Adds a text parameter to a procedure.
Adds a list parameter to a procedure.
When switched on, agents do commands over and over. There are different commands for each breed.
description.arg-description: The breed of the agents performing the commands attached here.

description.text: When switched on, agents do commands over and over. There are different commands for each breed.
When switched on, agents do commands once. There are different commands for each breed.
description.arg-description: The breed of the agents performing the commands attached here.

description.text: When switched on, agents do commands once. There are different commands for each breed.
When switched on, agents do commands over and over for seconds. There are different commands for each breed.
description.arg-description: The number of seconds for which the commands are run when switched on.
The breed of the agents performing the commands attached here.

description.text: When switched on, agents do commands over and over for a number of seconds. There are different commands for each breed.
This block serves as a wrapper around blocks that set up a model.
This block serves as a wrapper around blocks that set up a model.
A block used to define a monitor. Mointors appear in the runtime space where they dynamically report a value.
A block used to define a monitor. Mointors appear in the runtime space where they dynamically report a value.
A block used to define a slider. Sliders appear in the runtime space where you can dynamically change the value of its attached shared number variable.
Use the slider to change the value of this slider's attached shared number variable.
Defines a table that appears in the runtime space. Each input to its sockets describes a series in the graph. Values are graphed against time.
description.arg-description: Data values to be graphed.

description.text: Use the table to moniter the value of this graph's attached shared variable.
Defines a line graph that appears in the runtime space. Each input to its sockets describes a series in the graph. Values are graphed against time.
description.arg-description: Data values to be graphed.

description.text: Use the line graph to moniter the value of this graph's attached shared variable.
Defines a bar graph that appears in the runtime space. Each input to its sockets describes a series in the graph. Values in the graph may change dynamically over time.
description.arg-description: Data values to be graphed.

description.text: Use the bar graph to moniter the value of this graph's attached shared variable.
Resets the terrain to flat and green, and kills all of the agents in SpaceLand.
Kills all of the agents in SpaceLand.
Flattens the terrain in Spaceland and repaints it green.
Scatters all agents randomly around the terrain.
Sets the score to be the given value.
description.arg-description: The new value for the score.

description.text: Reports the current score.
Creates number of agents of the given breed.
description.arg-description: The number of agents to create.

description.text: Creates number of agents of the given breed and has each do the specified commands.
description.arg-description: The number of agents to create.
The commands for each agent to do.

description.text: Reports the name of the given breed.
Reports the number agents of this breed.
Reports the number agents of this breed that satisfy the given condition.
description.arg-description: A condition that must be true of the counted agents.

description.text: Scatters agents of this breed across SpaceLand.
Clears all agents of this breed.

Constantly checks for collisions between agents. If a collision occurs, causes the collider to run the code, and the collidee to run the code. Which agent is the collidee and which is the collider depends on the block. For example, if a Turtle and Frog collide, the collision block with "Turtles" as the first port and "Frogs" as the second port will assume that the Turtle is the collider and the Frog is the collidee.
description.arg-description: This is the code that the collider runs.
This is the code that the collidee runs. The label of this port determines which breed will be assumed to be collidee.

description.text: Selects a random shape.
